ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Greater knowledge of the differences between Old and Modern French, as well as a greater ability to translate in real time.
Practice and improvement in reading Old French, and reading from a manuscript. Increased familiarity with Arthurian legend and medieval French literature
language knowledge on medieval literary culture

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Short discussions of grammar at the beginning of the class could be expanded, with deconstructions of example sentences, as well as more directed acquisition of relevant vocabulary.

Class is very much a "practical" crash course in reading Old French. If you would struggle to read a manuscript, and have limited modern French skills, it might be a little overwhelming. That being said, I found it very enjoyable, and after the first few weeks, I didn't feel that I needed to stress very much in preparing for the class. Grammatical instruction was a little strange, generally just reading out loud of grammatical charts, so can't say I really grasped much of that beyond what I inferred from class and my knowledge of normal French.

strengths: manuscript choice (language, story, drawings), fabliaux weaknesses: discussions on medieval literature and culture during the last class were great, I wish there had been more of them before!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If they were interested in the subject, I would definitely recommend it as it gives them some guidance to get started with Old French.
Would recommend to anyone with a (serious) interest in Old French/medieval vernacular literature
yes, they'll improve their language skills quickly
